comments.author: vors
comments.body:
@jumpingyang001 there are some white-space changes on the whole file. I see that in some previous test-adding reviews as well. Reviewable handles it, but vanilla github diff tool doesn't. It makes history useless. Please, don't change whitespace. When you create PR and preview it, make sure that diff looks right. In this case it would revile that you made some unexpected changes. 

---

Review status: 0 of 1 files reviewed at latest revision, 5 unresolved discussions.

---

_[test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1, line 195 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/powershell/powershell/873#-KGAQmPEJMRg0Rm1t_cA:-KGAQmPEJMRg0Rm1t_cB:377297140) ([raw file](https://github.com/powershell/powershell/blob/5b8ac3a47f972ef5beed41e1425906966989dba3/test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1#L195)):_
By Pester convention, `Describe` has the form `Describe "what functionality you describe"`.  Tests describe function, not the tests. Change it to something like `Describe 'Cross-platform Remove-Variable'` or `Describe 'Remove-Variable basic functionality'`

---

_[test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1, line 199 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/powershell/powershell/873#-KGAS64Gb1OkTmjlM5TI:-KGAS64Gb1OkTmjlM5TJ:1429744340) ([raw file](https://github.com/powershell/powershell/blob/5b8ac3a47f972ef5beed41e1425906966989dba3/test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1#L199)):_
Nit pick: use spaces, like`$var1 = Get-...`,  same everywhere

---

_[test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1, line 200 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/powershell/powershell/873#-KGASBKKRCY6YDUU1Rd0:-KGASBKKRCY6YDUU1Rd1:203387255) ([raw file](https://github.com/powershell/powershell/blob/5b8ac3a47f972ef5beed41e1425906966989dba3/test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1#L200)):_

_[test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1, line 185 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/powershell/powershell/873#-KGAkxLH0eQT1GVV---Z:-KGAkxLIJa48ylGDxKDL:268489028) ([raw file](https://github.com/powershell/powershell/blob/510a436c3f4e805da8df46c1b2cdd789304019fb/test/powershell/Remove-Variable.Tests.ps1#L185)):_
Please, address my point about no-whitespace change.
You can revert the change and copy-paste the new code at the end of file to do that. 

If you didn't use git in this way, here is the workflow with comments to achieve it

```
# crate a new branch to experiment and not loose anything
git checkout -b new-remove-tests
# get changes back (2 because you did 2 commits in the PR)
git reset --hard HEAD~2
# paste the new code in text editor
git commit
# if everything is ok, do force-push
git push --force-with-lease origin new-remove-tests:RemoveVariablePesterUnitTest
```

---
